document.masterDocTitle: Annotated checklist of bats (Mammalia: Chiroptera) of Mount Cameroon, southwestern Cameroon

subSubSection.paragraph: COMMON NAMES. — English: Franquet’s Epauletted Fruit Bat. French: Epomophore de Franquet.

MATERIAL EXAMINED. — 171 specimens (including original data).

FIG. 4. —
Epomops franqueti (Tomes, 1860)

FIG. 5. —
Megaloglossus woermanni Pagenstecher, 1885

subSubSection.paragraph: ORIGINAL DATA. — 79 individuals ( 22 males and 57 females ) of this species were captured during our field surveys in disturbed habitats at altitudes below 1300 m a.s.l. ( Table 1 ). Both Eisentraut (1963) and Fedden & MacLeod (1986) also recorded this species in lowland, disturbed forest in Mount Cameroon .

HABITATS AND DISTRIBUTION. — This species is mostly distributed in Central Africa, but can also be encountered in parts of West and East Africa ( Kityo & Nalikka 2016 ). This species inhabits low to mid-elevation rainforest and some relic forest in savannah regions ( Happold 1987 ). Happold (2013a) pointed out that this species prefers secondary to primary forest and is often caught in gardens, and in clearings close to dense undergrowth where it roosts in dense foliage of large trees.
